definition: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) is a web service that provides resizable compute capacity in the cloud. It is designed to make web-scale computing easier for developers.

Amazon S3 is object storage built to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere. It offers high durability, availability, performance, security, and virtually unlimited scalability at very low costs
A highly scalable, fast, container management service that makes it easy to run, stop, and manage Docker containers on a cluster of EC2 instances

A fully managed Docker container registry that makes it easy for developers to store, manage, and deploy Docker container images. Amazon ECR is integrated with Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) and AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
A web service that Amazon Web Services (AWS) customers can use to manage users and user permissions within AWS
A service that provides block level storage volumes for use with EC2 instances

A file storage service for EC2 instances. Amazon EFS is easy to use and provides a simple interface with which file systems can be created an configured. Amazon EFS storage capacity grows and shrinks automatically as files are added and removed
A managed service that simplifies running Kubernetes on AWS without needing to stand up or maintain a Kubernetes control plane
A web service that applications, users, and devices can use to instantly send and receive notifications from the cloud
Reliable and scalable hosted queues for storing messages as they travel between computers
An infrastructure web services platform in the cloud for companies of all sizes

A distinct location within a Region that's insulated from failures in other Availability Zones, and provides inexpensive, low-latency network connectivity to other Availability Zones in the same Region
An open-source software development framework for defining cloud infrastructure in code and provisioning it through AWS CloudFormation

A document that defines who can access a particular bucket or object. Each bucket and object in Amazon S3 has an ACL. The document defines what each type of user can do, such as write and read permissions

An encrypted machine image stored in Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) or Amazon Simple Storage Service. AMIs function similar to a template of a computer's root drive. They contain the operating system and can also include software and layers of an application, such as database servers, middleware, and web servers
A web service for provisioning a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud virtual network
A representation of multiple EC2 instances that share similar characteristics, and that are treated as a logical grouping for the purposes of instance scaling and management

A web service that speeds up distribution of static and dynamic web content—such as .html, .css, .js, media files, and image files—to users by using a worldwide network of data centers. When a user requests content, the request is routed to the data center that provides the lowest latency (time delay). If the content is already in the location with the lowest latency, the CDN delivers it immediately. If not, the CDN retrieves it from an origin (for example, a web server or an Amazon S3 bucket). With some CDNs, an HTTPS connection can be configured between users and data centers, and between data centers and origin. Amazon CloudFront is an example of a CDN.
A unified downloadable and configurable tool for managing AWS services. Control multiple AWS services from the command line and automate them through scripts.
The strategies and technologies used by enterprises for the data analysis of business information
A fully managed ledger database that provides a transparent, immutable, and cryptographically verifiable transaction log ‎owned by a central trusted authority
A web service that can help migrate data to and from many widely used commercial and open-source databases

A process that's used to integrate data from multiple sources. Data is collected from sources (extract), converted to an appropriate format (transform), and written to a target data store (load) for purposes of analysis and querying. AWS Glue is an ETL service
A fully managed, highly available, in-memory cache for Amazon DynamoDB that delivers up to a 10 times performance improvement
The average amount of time that has passed between incidents
The average amount of time it takes to recover from an incident
The maximum time it should take to restore to normal operations following an outage or data loss

The maximum amount of data an organisation can tolerate losing; measured in time from the moment a failure occurs to the last backup. i.e. if a failure occurs and the last backup was 24 hours ago, the RPO is 24 hours

The AWS Cost and Usage Reports (AWS CUR) contains the most comprehensive set of cost and usage data available. Cost and Usage Reports can be used to publish AWS billing reports to an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket. Reports can break down costs by the hour, day, or month, by product or product resource, or by tags. AWS updates the report once a day in comma-separated value (CSV) format
A performance measure used to evaluate the efficiency or profitability of an investment or compare the efficiency of a number of different investments

CFM solutions help transform businesses through cost transparency, control, forecasting, and optimization. These solutions can also help enable a cost-conscious culture that drives accountability across all teams and functions. Finance teams can see where costs are coming from, run operations with minimal unexpected expenses, plan for dynamic cloud usage, and save on cloud expenses while teams scale their adoptions on the cloud. Sharing this with engineering teams can provide necessary financial context for their resource selection, use, and optimization.
A fully managed service that enables the building and running of applications that use Apache Kafka to process streaming data
In DynamoDB, a global secondary index can be created any time after creating a base table. In a global secondary index, the partition and hash keys can be different than the base table
In DynamoDB, a local secondary index can be created at any time and this allows queries to be performed on attributes that are not the partition or sort key
Type of transaction used by Amazon QLDB. Data storage systems that apply these are called transactional systems
Service used to generate tokens for IAM roles

SAML enables multiple web applications to be accessed using one set of login credentials. It works by passing authentication information in a particular format between two parties, usually an identity provider (idP) and a web application
A service that stores and verifies user identity. IdPs are typically cloud-hosted services, and they often work with single sign-on (SSO) providers to authenticate users
A session and user authentication service that permits a user to use one set of login credentials for multiple services
Subnet level firewall
EC2 instance level firewall
EC2 instance level firewall
EC2 instance level firewall
EC2 instance level firewall
Standards developed to enable secure information exchange via a public key infrastructure
Provides a framework and implementation for encryption, key generation and key agreement, and Message Authentication Code (MAC) algorithms

Designed by Microsoft and intended for use by developers of applications that will enable users to create and exchange documents and other data in a secure environment, especially over non-secure media such as the Internet
An encrypted tunnel through the internet connecting two devices or networks
An AWS service that allows the sharing of resources between accounts
AWS service for creating and managing cryptographic keys
A protocol for distributed file system; used by EFS and Network Attached Storage devices
The method used to specify IP addresses for a subnet or VPC; uses / followed by a number to indicate subnet mask
Managed email automation service; usually a distractor on the exam
In the context of SQS, FIFO means that the messages are processed in the order in which they arrive
AWS' fully managed relational database offering
An application load balancer automatically distributes incoming traffic across multiple targets, such as EC2 instances, containers, and IP addresses, in one or more Availability Zones
WORM protection is used in scenarios where it is imperative that data is not changed or deleted after it has been written; this is imposed in S3 using an object lock

Server-side encryption is the encryption of data at its destination by the application or service that receives it. Amazon S3 encrypts data at the object level as it writes it to disks in AWS data centers and decrypts it for when it's being accessed
Logical networking component in a VPC; represents a virtual network card
The ability to process data and perform complex calculations at high speeds
A network interface for Amazon EC2 instances that enables applications requiring high levels of inter-node communications to run at scale on AWS
A branch of Artificial Intelligence that focuses on training learning models using vast datasets
The primary filesystem used by Hadoop applications
The process of recovering from a partial outage, usually by creating a resilient architecture that can fail over to another region
A common unit of measurement for storage system performance based on drive speed and workload type
A type of disk drive that uses integrated circuits assemblies for data storage
A type of disk drive that uses magnetically charged platters for data storage
Tool that automatically assesses and converts the source database schema and a majority of the database code objects, ready for migrating to a different database engine
Call the AWS APIs right in the application code; supports many different languages
A global community of Amazon partners that leverages programs, expertise, and resources to build, market, and sell customer offerings

This one is wild and I don't know why it is MGN and not AMS?! Minimizes time-intensive, error-prone manual processes by automating the conversion of your source servers to run natively on AWS as part of a cloud migration
Simplifies and streamlines the process of migrating existing virtualized applications from on-prem data centres to Amazon EC2
A virtual server that uses software instead of a physical computer to run programs and deploy apps
A way to upload and download files to servers - not secure and should not be used (use SFTP or FTPS instead); runs on port 21
An inherently secure way to upload and download files to servers; runs on port 22
A secure way to upload and download files to servers; adds a layer of encryption using SSL or TLS; uses port 989
A specification on how to transport structured business-to-business data securely and reliably over the Internet. Security is achieved by using digital certificates and encryption
